title: Why don’t oil and water mix? - John Pollard

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why oil doesn't mix with water?

options.label: A
options.text: Energetics favors the interactions between oil and water molecules.

options.label: B
options.text: Entropy favors the separation of oil and water molecules.

options.label: C
options.text: Oil molecules are too large to fit into the hydrogen bonding network of water molecules.

options.label: D
options.text: Oil molecules are not attracted to water molecules.

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept that deals with the attractive forces between molecules?
What is the term that describes the way things and energy can be arranged based on random motion?
What happens to the salt ions when they are added to water?

options.label: A
options.text: They break apart and join the hydrogen bonding network immediately.

options.label: B
options.text: They are reluctant to break apart and join the dance.

options.label: C
options.text: They stay together as a group and don't interact with water.

options.label: D
options.text: They are repelled by water molecules.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why the water molecules try to engage the oil molecules in the dance?

options.label: A
options.text: Because oil molecules are great dancers.

options.label: B
options.text: Because oil molecules are small and fit into the hydrogen bonding network easily.

options.label: C
options.text: Because oil molecules are not great dancers and take up too much space.

options.label: D
options.text: Because oil molecules are attracted to water molecules.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the oil molecules when they are squeezed out by the water molecules?

options.label: A
options.text: They are repelled by water molecules and stay together as a group.

options.label: B
options.text: They are attracted to water molecules and join the dance.

options.label: C
options.text: They are pushed back to the side and band together to commiserate.

options.label: D
options.text: They are broken apart and join the hydrogen bonding network.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main factor that determines whether substances mix with water?
What is the reason why the salt ions add more possible arrangements to the dance?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are attracted to water molecules.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are not great dancers.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are small and fit into the hydrogen bonding network easily.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are part of the hydrogen bonding network.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the water molecules when the oil molecules are removed?

options.label: A
options.text: They are repelled by oil molecules and stay together as a group.

options.label: B
options.text: They are attracted to oil molecules and join the dance.

options.label: C
options.text: They are able to dance more freely and with more partners.

options.label: D
options.text: They are broken apart and join the hydrogen bonding network.
